cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about distant supervision relation extraction, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The paper proposes a novel adversarial learning framework for noise reduction in distant supervision data, which involves both generative and discriminative models. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to NLP and machine learning for language processing. 

The paper also involves deep learning techniques, such as Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), which are commonly used in various subfields of computer science. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics related to various machine learning techniques and applications. 

Moreover, the paper involves the use of artificial intelligence (AI) for relation extraction, which is a subfield of NLP and machine learning. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which covers topics related to various AI techniques and applications. 

The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques, such as distant supervision, which is a common approach for relation extraction. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which covers topics related to various IR techniques and applications.
